governing_body: Texas State Board of Plumbing Examiners (TSBPE)

license_types.name: Tradesman Plumber-Limited
license_types.description: Entry-level license for basic plumbing work on one- and two-family dwellings under supervision
license_types.experience_required: 4,000 hours of verifiable experience working in the plumbing trade

license_types.name: Journeyman Plumber
license_types.description: Standard license for commercial and residential plumbing - can work independently
license_types.experience_required: 8,000 hours of experience working in the plumbing trade

license_types.name: Master Plumber
license_types.description: Highest level - can supervise others, pull permits, run business, design systems
license_types.experience_required: 4 years as licensed Journeyman Plumber (or 1 year + DOL apprenticeship completion)

license_types.name: Plumbing Inspector
license_types.description: Municipal/county inspector license for code enforcement
license_types.experience_required: 500 hours training/experience OR current Master/Journeyman/PE/Architect license OR out-of-state inspector license

requirements.citizenship: Current U.S. citizen/national OR immigrant eligible to work in Texas
requirements.education: High school diploma or GED recommended. May grant up to 3 years credit toward experience requirement for accredited school/apprenticeship training (Journeyman level)
requirements.experience: Must be verifiable through Employer Certification forms. For Tradesman: must be registered as Plumber's Apprentice in Texas. For Journeyman: 8,000 hours minimum. For Master: 4 years as licensed Journeyman (or 1 year + DOL apprenticeship)

training_requirements.tradesman: 24-hour TSBPE-approved training course OR enrollment in DOL Office of Apprenticeship program
training_requirements.journeyman: 48-hour TSBPE-approved training course OR enrollment/completion of DOL Office of Apprenticeship program (not required if already licensed in another state)

requirements.fingerprinting: Required for all applicants - must obtain fingerprints for DOJ/FBI background check review and approval

examination.format: Computer-based testing at Pearson VUE centers (written exams) + Hands-on practical at TSBPE Austin/Waco facilities
examination.books_required: 2018 International Residential Code (Tradesman), 2018 International Plumbing Code and Fuel Gas Code (Journeyman/Master), Texas Plumbing License Law and Board Rules, OSHA regulations, Texas Accessibility Standards, NFPA-54 (Master only)

tradesman_practical.description: Hands-on: measuring, cutting, assembly of PVC, copper, threaded steel, cast iron; water heater installation review; design and install 2-story drainage/vent system

journeyman_practical.description: Hands-on installation skills demonstration (Tradesman moving to Journeyman exempt from practical retake)

sections: Plus pipe sizing charts and system design (98)

application_process.description: Register as Plumber's Apprentice with TSBPE (Tradesman applicants only). Begin documenting work hours with Employer Certification forms.
Complete required training: 24-hour course (Tradesman) or 48-hour course (Journeyman) approved by TSBPE, OR enroll in DOL apprenticeship program.
Obtain fingerprints for background check through approved vendor. See tsbpe.texas.gov/fingerprints for locations and instructions.

Apply online via Texas Online Licensing System (vo.licensing.hpc.texas.gov) OR download paper application from TSBPE website. Submit application fee, experience verification forms, and required documentation.
TSBPE reviews application and conducts background check (2-4 weeks). Upon approval, you receive 'Authorization to Test' email from Pearson VUE.
Schedule written exam at Pearson VUE website (www.pearsonvue.com/tsbpe) or call (888) 304-3589. Must schedule at least 24 hours in advance.
Take written exam at Pearson VUE test center. Bring government-issued photo ID. Results provided immediately. Written exam fee paid at scheduling.

If written exam passed AND practical required (Tradesman/Journeyman): Receive second Authorization to Test email within 10 days. Schedule practical exam at TSBPE Austin or Waco facility (must schedule 10 days in advance).
Take practical exam at TSBPE facility (Tradesman/Journeyman only). Bring photo ID. No shorts or open-toed shoes allowed.
Upon passing all required exams, pay initial license fee via TSBPE Online Licensing System. License certificate and pocket card mailed within 10-15 business days.

insurance_bonding.insurance_required: Not required for individual licensure. May be required by employer or for contractor registration.

renewal.period: Annual - random expiration date assigned at first issuance (6-18 months from exam pass date), then annually thereafter
renewal.ce_requirements: 6 hours of continuing professional education required annually to renew

reciprocity.requirements: Louisiana and Arkansas Journeyman licensees may obtain license through reciprocity without examination. Other states must meet Texas experience requirements and pass exams.

resources.study_guides: Examination Review Courses available free at tsbpe.texas.gov/printableforms
resources.pearson_vue_support: pearsonvuecustomerservice@pearson.com or Live Chat 8am-5pm CT Mon-Fri

pro_tips: Download FREE Examination Review Courses from TSBPE website - contains sample questions and content outlines
Initial Authorization to Test is good for 5 attempts on written exam - use them wisely
Wait times between retakes: 30 days after 1st failure, 60 days after 2nd, 90 days after 3rd+
All attempts must be completed within 1 year of initial application authorization
For Master exam: bring snacks/lunch - it's a 6.5 hour marathon with 308 questions
Tradesman/Journeyman: You must pass BOTH written AND practical - they're separate exams
Study the manufacturer installation instructions for PVC, copper, and threaded joints for practical
Pearson VUE test centers are throughout Texas - not just Austin (but practical IS Austin/Waco only)
NO personal items allowed in testing room - everything goes in locker including phone, watch, wallet
Review courses are topic-specific: separate courses for Tradesman, Journeyman, Master, Inspector
Take the 30-minute break on Master exam - it's built in and won't count against your time
common_pitfalls: Not obtaining fingerprints before applying - this will delay your authorization
Forgetting you need BOTH a 24-hour OR 48-hour training course certificate to apply
Applying before you're registered as an Apprentice (Tradesman applicants)
Not bringing government-issued photo ID to exam - you'll be turned away, no refund
Wearing shorts or open-toed shoes to practical exam - not allowed, you'll forfeit exam
Thinking the practical is easy because written is 'computer-based' - practical has ~50% fail rate
Not scheduling practical exam within your authorization window - it expires
Missing the fact that exam fees are SEPARATE from application fees - budget accordingly
Assuming passing written means you get license - Tradesman/Journeyman still need practical
Not checking Pearson VUE junk/spam folder for Authorization to Test email
Bringing prohibited items to test center - even having phone on you can disqualify you
Not understanding that vouchers and exam fees are non-refundable if you no-show or cancel late
